item.title: Setting up a Private PyPI Repository on the Google Cloud Platform
item.description: Update 14/03/21: Google recently announced that the Artifact Registry now supports PyPI repositories as well (alpha). I haven’t had the time to test it myself yet, but it definitely looks promising. Thus, please consider to use the Artifact Registry instead. Every once in a while I am trying to solve a problem that is seemingly so fundamental that there must exist an off-the-shelf solution already. Setting up a private repository for Python packages on the Google Cloud Platform (GCP) falls into this category.
